subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Text Conversion
msgSnippet: ... If I may put in my oar, I would suggest poetry for your first conversions.  Not only are the pieces generally shorter, but they will be more familiar to
messageBody:
Re: [Read_Alphabet] Text Conversion

Once its done... hopefully sometime next month, I'm going to start converting some of the Gutenberg classic text pieces into QS. If anyone has any recommendations of writings they'd like to see in QS please let me know.
 
  If I may put in my oar, I would suggest poetry for your first conversions.  Not only are the pieces generally shorter, but they will be more familiar to the reader, increasing ease of reading and enjoyment.

Also, I have found particularly pleasing the fact that in QS, words that rhyme look alike, whereas it's only coincidence if they look alike in TO. (As a quick example tough and bluff vs. taf n blaf.)

--
- /bob /mkbrMm
